Package fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing

Class LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree<T>

java.lang.Object
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.AbstractIndexingTree<T,​fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.LimitedPrecisionIndexingNode<T>>
fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree<T>

Direct Known Subclasses:
ExpandingLimitedPrecisionIndexingTree
public class LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree<T> extends AbstractIndexingTree<T,​fr.cnrs.iees.uit.indexing.LimitedPrecisionIndexingNode<T>>
Similar to a BoundedRegionIndexingTree, but internally using discrete rather than continuous coordinates.
Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 8 oct. 2020

  • Constructor Details

    • LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree

      public LimitedPrecisionIndexingTree​(Box domain, double precision)
      Constructor from a box. All items indexed by this tree will stay inside this box. The precision argument is used to scale the coordinates internally: all coordinate values are multiplied by 1/precision and truncated to longs, so that exact comparison of locations becomes possible. In this system, two or more items can have exactly the same location.
      Parameters:
      domain - the initial domain to start the tree with
      precision - the precision of coordinates - a distance smaller than precision is considered equal to zero

  • Method Details

    • setOptimisation

      public void setOptimisation​(boolean o)

      Setting this to true will balance the tree depth and size following P. Tovainen's benchmarking which shows that a relatively general solution exists which enables to keep performance constant when the tree grows. Basically, it adapts the storage capacity of leaf nodes to the tree size so that the average number of searches to find a particular node is kept reasonably low.

      See the benchmarking details there.

      Parameters:
      o - whether optimisation should be enabled (true) or not (false).

    • getNearestItem

      public T getNearestItem​(Point at)
      Description copied from interface: IndexingTree

      Get the item closest to location.

      CAUTION: will pick the first item encountered if two or more items are found exactly at the same distance of the argument.

      Parameters:
      at - the location
      Returns:
      the item closest to this location

    • getNearestItems

      public Collection<T> getNearestItems​(Point at)
      Description copied from interface: IndexingTree

      Get the items closest to location.

      Will pick all the items found at exactly the same distance of the argument.

      Parameters:
      at - the location
      Returns:
      the list of items closest to this location

    • getNearestItems

      public Collection<T> getNearestItems​(Point at, int rank)

      Returns nearest items up to rank, e.g. if rank = 3 return the nearest items, the 2nd nearest items and the 3rd nearest item as a flat list.

      Parameters:
      at - the location which neighbours are searched
      rank - the rank of the neighbour wanted (1 = neares neighbour, 2 = second nearest, etc.)
      Returns:
      the rankth nearest item to the point argument
